ghost

Class Ghost

  • java.lang.Object
    • ghost.Ghost

  • public class Ghost
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents ghost object in game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ghost(processing.core.PImage ambusher, processing.core.PImage ignorant, processing.core.PImage chaser, processing.core.PImage whim, Waka waka, processing.core.PImage fright, Config config)
      Constructs a new Ghost object.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addFrightTime(long time)
      Method to add the frightened mode start, and end time to the fright times list.
      void chaseAmbusher()
      This method finds the target location for ambusher when in chase mode, and then calls the ghost move function to move the ghost accordingly.

      This method finds the target location for chaser when in chase mode, and then calls the ghost move function to move the ghost accordingly.

      This method finds the target location for whim when in chase mode, and then calls the ghost move function to move the ghost accordingly.

      Checking for different top, bottom, left, and right values of ghost, and wall that they are colliding or not when ghost is trying to move right.

      Checking for different top, bottom, left, and right values of ghost, and wall that they are colliding or not when ghost is trying to move upwards.
      void dieGhost(java.lang.String ghostType)
      This method changes the status of the ghost referred to by the ghost type parameter from alive to not alive.
      void draw(processing.core.PApplet app)
      It is the draw method which is called sixty (frame rate) times per second.
      boolean getFrightened()
      Returns true if the ghost is in frightened mode, else it returns false.

      Returns the x-axis position, followed by y-axis position of ambusher ghosts in the form of a list based on the target in either scatter or chase mode.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ghost

        public Ghost(processing.core.PImage ambusher,
             processing.core.PImage ignorant,
             processing.core.PImage chaser,
             processing.core.PImage whim,
             Waka waka,
             processing.core.PImage fright,
             Config config)
        Constructs a new Ghost object.
        Parameters:
        ambusher - PImage of ambusher ghost.
        ignorant - PImage of ignorant ghost.
        chaser - PImage of chaser ghost.
        whim - PImage of whim ghost.
        waka - Object of type Waka.
        fright - PImage of ghost in frightened mode.
        config - Object of type Config.

    • Method Detail

      • getRoundNumber

        public int getRoundNumber()
        Returns the number of rounds of the mode lengths that the ghost has completed. That is it tells how many times the ghost has traversed through the whole mode lengths list switching between scatter, and chase mode accordingly.
        Returns:
        Mode length round number.

      • getFrightTimes

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> getFrightTimes()
        Returns the list of times at which the frightened modes of the ghost started, and ended. The list would be empty if the ghost has not entered any frightened mode yet.
        Returns:
        List of frightened mode start, and end times.

      • getFrightened

        public boolean getFrightened()
        Returns true if the ghost is in frightened mode, else it returns false.
        Returns:
        Whether ghost is in frightened mode or not.

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> getTargetsAmbusher()

      • setAmbusherAlive

        public void setAmbusherAlive(java.lang.Boolean alivee)
        Sets the parameter as the ambushers's alive status. If the parameter passed is true then it sets that ambusher is alive, else if parameter is false then it sets that the ambusher is not alive.
        Parameters:
        alivee - The status telling if ambusher is alive or not.

      • setChaserAlive

        public void setChaserAlive(java.lang.Boolean alivee)

        Parameters:
        alivee - The status telling if chaser is alive or not.

        Parameters:

        Parameters:

      • setFrightened

        public void setFrightened(boolean frightened)
        Returns true if the ghost is in frightened mode, else it returns false;
        Parameters:
        frightened - Frightened status of ghost.

      • addFrightTime

        public void addFrightTime(long time)
        Method to add the frightened mode start, and end time to the fright times list. The parameter time is the frightened mode start time, or the time when a super fruit was eaten.
        Parameters:
        time - Frightened mode start time.

      • getTimeOffset

        public long getTimeOffset()
        Method that returns the amount of time spent in frightened mode already, which needs to be adjusted when finding the current ghost mode. After frightened mode the ghost needs to continue from the previous mode, the time elapsed in the frightened mode should not be taken into account when calculating the next ghost mode. This gives the amount of time spent in frightened mode already.
        Returns:
        Time spent in frightened mode.

      • modeLengthAdjuster

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> modeLengthAdjuster(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> modeLength)
        This method returns the mode lengths list in a cumulative format.
        Parameters:
        modeLength - List of mode lengths.
        Returns:
        Cumulative mode lengths.

      • move

        public void move(long startTime)
        This method selects and calls the required ghost mode based on the time. The parameter that is passed is the time at which the game started.
        Parameters:
        startTime - Time at which game started.

      • isAlive

        public void isAlive(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> targets,
                    processing.core.PImage spirit,
                    java.lang.String type)
        This method checks if the waka, and the ghost are colliding or not. If the ghost and waka are colliding, and ghost is in frightened mode then the ghost dies. If the collison happens and ghost is not in frightened mode, then waka or player dies. This method calls the functions to kill waka, and ghost when needed.
        Parameters:
        targets - Position of ghost whose type is passed as parameter.
        spirit - PImage of the ghost whose type is passed.
        type - String telling type of ghost.

      • dieGhost

        public void dieGhost(java.lang.String ghostType)
        This method changes the status of the ghost referred to by the ghost type parameter from alive to not alive. That is it kills the ghost. The ghost's alive status becomes false. The parameter string "ambusher" refers to ambusher ghost, "chaser" refers to chaser ghost, "ignorant" refers to ignorant ghost, and "whim" refers to whim ghost.
        Parameters:
        ghostType - Type of ghost to be killed.

      • chaseAmbusher

        public void chaseAmbusher()
        This method finds the target location for ambusher when in chase mode, and then calls the ghost move function to move the ghost accordingly.

      • scatterAmbusher

        public void scatterAmbusher()
        This method finds the target location for ambusher when in scatter mode, and then calls the ghost move function to move the ghost accordingly.

      • chaseChaser

        public void chaseChaser()
        This method finds the target location for chaser when in chase mode, and then calls the ghost move function to move the ghost accordingly.

      • scatterChaser

        public void scatterChaser()
        This method finds the target location for chaser when in scatter mode, and then calls the ghost move function to move the ghost accordingly.

      • chaseIgnorant

        This method finds the target location for ignorant when in chase mode, and then calls the ghost move function to move the ghost accordingly.
        Parameters:
        targets - Array list of positions of ignorant ghost.

      • scatterIgnorant

      • ghostMove

        public void ghostMove(long targetx,
                      long targety,
                      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> targets,
                      processing.core.PImage spirit,
                      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> movesList)
        This method is responsible for moving the ghost based on its target location.
        Parameters:
        targetx - x-axis target position.
        targety - y-axis target position.
        targets - List of ghost positions.
        spirit - PImage of ghost which has to move.
        movesList - List of moves made by ghost previously.

      • collisonUp

        public boolean collisonUp(long wallTop,
                          long wallBottom,
                          long wallLeft,
                          long wallRight,
                          long ghostTop,
                          long ghostBottom,
                          long ghostLeft,
                          long ghostRight)
        Checking for different top, bottom, left, and right values of ghost, and wall that they are colliding or not when ghost is trying to move upwards. It returns true if the ghost collides with wall, when it tries to move upwards, else it returns false.
        Parameters:
        wallTop - Coordinates of the top of wall grid.
        wallBottom - Coordinates of the bottom of wall grid.
        wallLeft - Coordinates of the left side of wall grid.
        wallRight - Coordinates of the right of wall grid.
        ghostTop - Coordinates of the top of ghost.
        ghostBottom - Coordinates of the bottom of ghost.
        ghostLeft - Coordinates of the left side of ghost.
        ghostRight - Coordinates of the right side of ghost.
        Returns:
        Outcome of ghost trying to move upwards.

      • collisonDown

        public boolean collisonDown(long wallTop,
                            long wallBottom,
                            long wallLeft,
                            long wallRight,
                            long ghostTop,
                            long ghostBottom,
                            long ghostLeft,
                            long ghostRight)
        Checking for different top, bottom, left, and right values of ghost, and wall that they are colliding or not when ghost is trying to move downwards. It returns true if the ghost collides with wall, when it tries to move downwards, else it returns false.
        Parameters:
        wallTop - Coordinates of the top of wall grid.
        wallBottom - Coordinates of the bottom of wall grid.
        wallLeft - Coordinates of the left side of wall grid.
        wallRight - Coordinates of the right of wall grid.
        ghostTop - Coordinates of the top of ghost.
        ghostBottom - Coordinates of the bottom of ghost.
        ghostLeft - Coordinates of the left side of ghost.
        ghostRight - Coordinates of the right side of ghost.
        Returns:
        Outcome of ghost trying to move downwards.

        public boolean collisonLeft2(long wallTop,
                             long wallBottom,

                             long wallRight,

                             long ghostLeft,

      • isCollidingUp

        public boolean isCollidingUp(long startx,
                             long starty,
                             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> targets,
                             processing.core.PImage spirit)
        This method calculates the top, bottom, left, and right position of wall, and ghost, and checks if it is colliding when ghost tries to move upwards or not. It returns true if the ghost is able to move upwards without colliding, else it returns false.
        Parameters:
        startx - x-axis position of ghost.
        starty - y-axis position of ghost.
        targets - List of positions of ghost.
        spirit - PImange of the ghost which we are trying to move upwards.
        Returns:
        Outcome of ghost trying to move upwards.

      • isCollidingDown

        public boolean isCollidingDown(long startx,
                               long starty,
                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> targets,
                               processing.core.PImage spirit)
        This method calculates the top, bottom, left, and right position of wall, and ghost, and checks if it is colliding when ghost tries to move downwards or not. It returns true if the ghost is able to move downwards without colliding, else it returns false.
        Parameters:
        startx - x-axis position of ghost.
        starty - y-axis position of ghost.
        targets - List of positions of ghost.
        spirit - PImange of the ghost which we are trying to move downwards.
        Returns:
        Outcome of ghost trying to move downwards.

        public boolean isCollidingRight(long startx,
                                long starty,
                                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> targets,
                                processing.core.PImage spirit)
        This method calculates the top, bottom, left, and right position of wall, and ghost, and checks if it is colliding when ghost tries to move right or not. It returns true if the ghost is able to move right without colliding, else it returns false.
        Parameters:

        starty - y-axis position of ghost.
        targets - List of positions of ghost.
        spirit - PImange of the ghost which we are trying to move right.

        public boolean isCollidingLeft(long startx,
                               long starty,
                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> targets,
                               processing.core.PImage spirit)
        This method calculates the top, bottom, left, and right position of wall, and ghost, and checks if it is colliding when ghost tries to move left or not. It returns true if the ghost is able to move left without colliding, else it returns false.
        Parameters:

        starty - y-axis position of ghost.
        targets - List of positions of ghost.
        spirit - PImange of the ghost which we are trying to move left.
        Returns:
        Outcome of ghost trying to move left.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        It is called sixty (frame rate) times per second.

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet app)
        It is the draw method which is called sixty (frame rate) times per second. It draws the image of different ghosts at their respective position using the required PImage.
        Parameters:
        app - PApplet app object.
